alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 9:43PM EST until January 03 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Levisa Fork Big Sandy River at Prestonsburg affecting Floyd County. For the Big Sandy River...including Elkhorn City, Pikeville, Prestonsburg, Paintsville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Levisa Fork Big Sandy River at Prestonsburg. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Flood gate is closed to the storm drain system in Prestonsburg. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Saturday the stage was 21.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 9 AM Sunday.
